channel.title: 20th Century Music for Piano
channel.description:
A series of performances of 20th century piano compositions as well as interviews with the performing artists.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: 4: John Cage
item.description: This program focuses on the works of controversial composer John Cage. Pianist Jeanne Kerstein performs several of his piano pieces.
item.dc:creator: Bennett, Myron
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: 7: Stefan Wolpe: Form for Piano
item.description: This episode features a performance of Form by German composer Stefan Wolpe, whose works have not been as widely recorded as those of many of his contemporaries.
item.dc:creator: Bennett, Myron
item.dc:subject: Wolpe, Stefan

item.title: 1: Bagatelles by Béla Bartók
item.description: In this program, Jeanne Kerstein, an internationally known interpreter of contemporary piano music, performs Béla Bartók's Bagatelles and discusses the early work's importance to Bartók's development as a composer.
item.dc:creator: Bennett, Myron
item.dc:subject: Piano music

item.title: 3: Sports et divertissements by Erik Satie
item.description: This program features a performance of Sports et divertissements by Erik Satie, who was once considered a minor composer but whose influence has increased as complete recordings of his piano works have become available.
item.dc:creator: Bennett, Myron
item.dc:subject: Satie, Erik, 1866-1925

item.title: 2: Piano Sonata by Elliott Carter
item.description: In this program, pianist Jeanne Kerstein performs Elliott Carter's Piano Sonata, written in 1946, which represents the composer's neo romantic phase.
item.dc:creator: Bennett, Myron
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: 6: Sounds and Silences by Jenő Takács
item.description: In this program, internationally known pianist Jeanne Kerstein performs Sounds and Silences by Hungarian composer Jenő Takács, a friend and contemporary of Béla Bartók and Zoltán Kodály.
item.dc:creator: Bennett, Myron
item.dc:subject: Takács, Jenő, 1902-2005
